column3: I'm currently racing two Orange Pi's with 2 GB memory. This PR means cache rarely grows beyond 300 MB, but it's still a bit faster than master; after 5 days it's at 2018-01-27 vs. master is still at 2017-11-25.
utACK ac51a26bdc69dc35e1f4f89b62c3134047e93bc1. This should be a safe first improvement. We can later make the overshoot value configurable or smarter, but this should already be a lot better.

Post-merge tested ACK.\n\nI ran this on some memory-constrained Linodes (dbcache=1000, prune=5000, and both connect= to a single nearby fully synced node; 2GB memory, 50GB disk), and saw a reasonably consistent 15% performance increase compared to not having this patch.
@martinpgaunt it just works, if you download Bitcoin Core 0.17 when it comes out in a couple of weeks (or a bit later).
BTW, why 10%, in IBD could be even more no?
